projects.name: 1.1.4.23 UNDP - Climate change mitigation and adaptation
projects.description:
Building upon Serbia’s NDC commitments, the action is advancing medium and long-term adaptation planning in the Republic of Serbia by formulation of a comperhensive National Adaptation Plan (NAP), enabling the Government of Serbia to build and strengthen capacities for mainstreaming climate change adaptation (CCA), produce actionable climate risk and vulnerability assessments, and implement effective methods, tools and information systems to better inform decision-making on climate risks. 
The a
projects.outcome: Communities have increased resilience to climate induced and human-made disasters

projects.name: 3.2.4.9 UNDP-  South Eastern and Eastern Europe Clearinghouse for the Control of Small Arms and Light Weapons (SEESAC)
projects.description: Strengthen the capacities of national and regional stakeholders to control and reduce the proliferation and misuse of small arms and light weapons, advance gender equality, facilitate regional cooperation and thus contribute to enhanced stability, security and development in South Eastern and Eastern Europe.
projects.outcome: Regional and transborder cooperation, security, and trust building are enhanced

projects.name: 1.1.3.13 UNDP - Infrastructure improvements
projects.description: Strengthening resilience at both national and local for which engineering services of various specializations are required. Management and oversight of infrastructure activities and coordination of subsidiary work in the field of electrical, mechanical geological, traffic, and environmental engineering. Provision of support in the implementation of key priorities of the Government plans which are in line with progress in achieving the Sustainable Development Goals.
projects.outcome: Infrastructure norms and standards mainstream climate change and resilience

projects.name: 3.1.3.15 IOM -Contributing to more systematic registration of people without personal documents
projects.outcome: Institutional and operational capacities in the area of home affairs are strengthened

projects.name: 1.3.1.5 UNOPS- EU Support to Local Development Programme - EU PRO+
projects.description:
EU PRO PLUS focuses its work on enhancing territorial development management, supporting economic growth, and improving social infrastructure and cohesion. 
Within efforts to Improve development planning and introduce integrated territorial investment concept, the Programme supports development of Sustainable Urban Development (SUD) and Integrated Territorial Investment (ITI) strategies using EU territorial mechanisms. The key beneficiaries are local self-governments and regional development age
projects.outcome: Local development strategies adopt an area-based approach

projects.name: 3.2.1.15 UNDP- National and local mechanisms and capacities for good governance improved
projects.description: Capacity building of central authorities for good and gender responsive governance
projects.outcome: Governance systems for planning, budgeting, and monitoring of national and local development are more efficient and SDG focused

projects.name: 2.1.2.5 UNOPS - EU Support to Social Housing and Active Inclusion Programme
projects.description:
Designed to enhance the implementation of social inclusion policies in Serbia and provide sustainable housing solutions accompanied with active inclusion measures for the most vulnerable population, such as members of the Roma communities, disadvantaged
women, in particular women victims of domestic violence, youth in/leaving care, persons with disabilities, and others who live in inadequate housing conditions. Objective is to contribute to increased social inclusion of and gender equality among
projects.outcome: Expanded and innovative social care services are supported to ensure improved living conditions

projects.name: 1.3.2.29 UNDP - Sustainable Business and Investment Promotion
projects.description: Promote and support sustainable investment in Serbia
projects.outcome: A greater share of economic activities transition towards circularity: changing how we produce, consume and trade

projects.name: 1.3.3.6 UNDP- Innovation ecosystem improved
projects.description: Prepare and support Serbian public administration and the economy for digital transformation, enabling the Government of Serbia to provide more transparency and accountable digital services that meet the expectations of women and men boys and girls and their needs as well as the needs of the economy to the benefit of the society as a whole.
projects.outcome: Science, technology, and innovation benefit men and women equally

projects.name: 2.2.1.3 UNICEF- Quality and inclusive pre-university education, including early childhood education and care; TA for policy development, financing and management  of quality and inclusive preschool ed
projects.outcome: Formal education (incl. TVET) becomes a key enabler for leaving no one behind

projects.description: Support policy improvements and pilot investments for improved energy efficiency in public buildings, among corporate sector and industries; increasing the share of renewables
projects.outcome: Serbia shifts its energy consumption to be cleaner and more efficient and promote renewables

projects.name: 3.2.1.16 UNDP - EU for Public Finance Management in Serbia
projects.description: Support to GOS to align with the EU acquis and fulfil requirements of the EU standards and achieve progress in reform areas related to PFM
projects.outcome: Governance systems for planning, budgeting, and monitoring of national and local development are more efficient and SDG focused

projects.name: 2.1.3.14 Joint Programme (UNDP) Ending violence, empowering change
projects.description: The JP aims to create a society where stakeholders work together to establish a gender responsive environment, enabling women and girls to fully exercise their rights and make independent decisions. projects.outcome: State institutions and CSOs ensure effective prevention and improved access to gender sensitive quality services for survivors of violence, exploitation and abuse

projects.name: 3.2.1.17 UNDP - Digital transformation of public administration accelerated
projects.description: Prepare and support Serbian public administration and the economy for digital transformation, enabling the Government of Serbia to provide more transparency and accountable digital services, including telecommunications and cyber security
projects.outcome: Governance systems for planning, budgeting, and monitoring of national and local development are more efficient and SDG focused

projects.name: 1.1.4.24 UNDP - Natural and human-induced risks
projects.description: With the EU support UNDP is assisting Sector for Emergency Management of the Ministry of Interior in developing National DRR Strategy. UNDP also supports Ministry of Public Investments in adpoting Post-Disaster Needs Assessment methodology aligned with PDNA approach. UNDP also supports better preparedness of responders in emergencies.
projects.outcome: Communities have increased resilience to climate induced and human-made disasters

projects.name: 2.1.1.21 Joint Programme (WHO) EU for Enabling a More Responsive Healthcare System
projects.description: The Action will contribute to the development of effective, efficient and sustainable organizational structures for preparedness and response to major public health threats of different nature at all levels of health care. This Action will support the health sector in Serbia to meet its national policy objectives as prescribed by the Public Health Strategy 2018-2026, Strategy on Development of Mental Health Protection, National Program for Health and Environment and accompanying action plans.
projects.outcome: More people benefit from universal health coverage, including mental health, drug abuse prevention, and healthier lifestyles

projects.name: 2.2.2.1 UNHCR - Socio-economic integration support for refugees including education, access to the job market and skills development
projects.description: UNHCR supports refugee women and men with their socio-economic integration in Serbia in different areas: access to education, skills building and training, and access to the labor market. This is done in collaboration with the competent ministries and the private sector. It also supports a wider conducive environment for the integration of refugees in Serbian society and working with relevant Ministries to reduce barriers and facilitate access.
projects.outcome: More people access informal education, life skills and life-long learning including digital literacy

projects.outcome: More people benefit from universal health coverage, including mental health, drug abuse prevention, and healthier lifestyles

projects.name: 2.3.3.7 UNHCR - Community initiatives for social cohesion
projects.description: Partnerships with CSO's and local stakeholders for implementation of community-based projects supporting Refugees and Asylum Seekers, promoting socio-cultural dialogue and community cohesion, in line with local policies.
projects.outcome: People across generations benefit from strengthened community cohesion and cultural connections

projects.description:
EU PRO PLUS focuses its work on enhancing territorial development management, supporting economic growth, and improving social infrastructure and cohesion.

projects.outcome: Women and men have access to more decent job opportunities and fair competitive trade

projects.name: 1.3.2.28 UNDP - Circular Economy
projects.description: Reducing community carbon footprint by advancing circular economy (CE) through  i) the establishment of an enabling policy and institutional framework aligned with the EU CE policies with related training and other capacity building; ii) the establishment of a Low Carbon Communities Innovation Platform (LCCIP) to source and support the development and implementation of new resource efficient circular economy related business ideas, products, investments and processes.
projects.outcome: A greater share of economic activities transition towards circularity: changing how we produce, consume and trade

projects.description: Capacities of the Ministry of Family Welfare and Demography strengthened and population policy coordination across public institutions improved

projects.outcome: More people access informal education, life skills and life-long learning including digital literacy

projects.name: 3.2.1.19 Joint Programme (UNOPS) PRO - Local Governance for People and Nature
projects.description: The JP aims to contribute to improving the well-being and quality of life of citizens through improved local governments (LG), social inclusion and environmental protection in 110 cities and municipalities in Serbia.This is done through capcity strengthening of LGs and their administration and organisation, of relevant local actors for developing local evidence-based strategies, and of LGs for the implementation of enviornmental protection governance in practice.
projects.outcome: Governance systems for planning, budgeting, and monitoring of national and local development are more efficient and SDG focused

projects.name: 3.2.3.11 WHO-Support Serbia in preparedness and response for health related emergencies BCA/emergencies operations and appeals (25%)
projects.description: Support Serbia preparedness and response capacities to rapidly detect and response to health-related emergencies affecting most vulnerable groups, including women and girls, as well as to reduce vaccination hesitancy in Serbia through risk communication and community engagement on national and local level. Special attention will be paid to strengthening the health system to respond to challenges related to potential emergencies, with a focus on primary health care as a connector for the resilien
projects.outcome: Emergency preparedness and response guarantees that all lives are equal

projects.name: 3.1.3.2 UNHCR - Asylum system capacity development support
projects.description: Support for capacity development of the asylum system and provision of legal counselling and representation to persons seeking international protection in Serbia, highlighting the need of specialized legal and social services towards refugee women and girls.
projects.outcome: Institutional and operational capacities in the area of home affairs are strengthened

projects.name: 3.2.4.10 UNDP  - Support to confidence-building in the Western Balkans
projects.description: Increase accountability for war crimes and support the role of youth in promoting increased mutual understanding, constructive narrative, respect for diversity and gender equality in the Western Balkans region
projects.outcome: Regional and transborder cooperation, security, and trust building are enhanced

projects.name: 3.1.1.29 UNOPS EU for the Rule of Law - Technical Capacity Facility for the Implementation of Action Plans for Chapters 23 and 24
projects.description: The Project is designed to enhance the technical capacity of the institutions implementing the Action Plans for Chapter 23 - Justice Judiciary and Fundamental Rights, and the Chapter 24 - Justice, Freedom, and Security. projects.outcome: National and local authorities, including the judicial system, are supported in policymaking and implementation that guarantees rights for all

projects.name: 3.2.2.7 UNDP- Fostering civic engagement and representation

projects.description: Support Serbia preparedness and response capacities to rapidly detect and response to health-related emergencies affecting most vulnerable groups, including women and girls, as well as to reduce COVID19 vaccination hesitancy in Serbia through risk communication and community engagement on national and local level.
projects.outcome: Emergency preparedness and response guarantees that all lives are equal

projects.outcome: More people benefit from universal health coverage, including mental health, drug abuse prevention, and healthier lifestyles

projects.outcome: Formal education (incl. TVET) becomes a key enabler for leaving no one behind

projects.description: To enhance the capabilities of the authorities to implement holistic solutions to economic and social empowerment of returnees.
projects.outcome: Expanded and innovative social care services are supported to ensure improved living conditions

projects.name: 2.3.2.6 UNDP-Support to migration management
projects.description: Migration policies aligned with labour market dynamics. Harness the development benefits and reduce negative effects of migration for host and home communities, migrant men, women and their family members.  Support national and local governments to integrate migration considerations into key policy areas or design new policies that aim to ensure inclusion for all.

projects.name: 3.1.3.15 UNHCR - Strengthening reception conditions
projects.description: UNHCR supports the strengthening of the reception conditions in Serbia
projects.outcome: National and local authorities, including the judicial system, are supported in policymaking and implementation that guarantees rights for all

projects.name: 3.1.3.8 IOM - Western Balkans Readmission Capacity Building Facility
projects.description: Strengthening readmission cooperation with countries of origin thus improving human rights-based and gender sensitive return management
projects.outcome: Institutional and operational capacities in the area of home affairs are strengthened

Finalization of the Methodology for agricultural sector Post Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) in 20 munici

projects.description: Contribute to the efficient, inclusive and sustainable implementation of the Green Agenda in Serbia by improving policy and base-conditions for the more efficient implementation of the Green Agenda in Serbia, supporting pilot projects within the five priority areas of the Green Agenda (including the pillar 3 on depollution of environment with strong focus on air quality) and promoting opportunities for future scale-up financing. projects.outcome: Cities implement clean air strategies as part of urban development

projects.name: Combating violence against women and girls in Serbia
projects.description: The Project overall goal/impact is to reduce violence against women and girls in Serbia. Three outcomes are envisaged: 1) Judiciary improves response to VAWG cases, 2) National level authorities and general public recognize and safeguard digital dimension of violence against women and girls, 3) Women survivors of violence have access to high quality integrated services provided by women CSOs. The Project intends to implement a series of educational, analytical (research) activities to capture kn
projects.outcome: State institutions and CSOs ensure effective prevention and improved access to gender sensitive quality services for survivors of violence, exploitation and abuse

projects.name: 3.1.3.14  UNODC - Countering Trafficking in Firearms, Their Parts and Ammunition in Express Courier and Postal Parcels: project HERME
projects.description: To enhance national and regional capacities to prevent and counter the illicit trafficking of firearms, parts, components and ammunition in postal parcels, related offences
projects.outcome: Institutional and operational capacities in the area of home affairs are strengthened

projects.name: 3.1.3.18 Joint Programme (UNICEF) Promoting Evidence-based Migration Governance for Maximizing Development Potential of Migration
projects.description: The intervention builds on the recognition that good migration governance requires an inclusive approach to sectoral development planning, coupled with capacities for evidence-generation and policy design and implementation. It aims to promote data-driven migration policy and planning in the Republic of Serbia, through developing national and local capacities and expertise in comprehensive migration data collection and analysis, combining migration policy with sustainable development planning.
projects.outcome: Institutional and operational capacities in the area of home affairs are strengthened

projects.description: Policy advice and capacity building to adopt and scale-up risk-based and gender sensitive management and public health surveillance of sanitation. In addition. through this outcome support will be provided to the national authorities in responding to the antimicrobial resistance problem through the prism of the "One Health" approach.

projects.name: 1.1.4.26 FAO Emergency livelihoods assistance to floods-affected farming households in Serbia

projects.outcome: Communities have increased resilience to climate induced and human-made disasters

projects.name: 1.2.2.9 FAO-Enabling environment at policy, field and market levels for Forest Landscape Restoration (FLR) to achieve Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN) in Serbia (MSP)
projects.description: The project aims to promote forest landscape restoration (FLR) in order to achieve neutrality of land degradation (LDN) in the Republic of Serbia.  The outcome of the project should be the recovery and restoration of priority areas, the establishment of support mechanisms for LDN monitoring, as well as the improvement of institutional capacities in gender sensitive FLR planning and implementation at the national level.
projects.outcome: Serbia protects ecosystems, natural resources and biodiversity

projects.name: 1.3.4.11 ILO - Ensuring adequate access to grievance mechanisms for the workers in automotive, electrical, and textile industry in Serbia
projects.description: Following its adoption in 2021 the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (SCDDA) came into force on January 1, 2023, requiring companies covered by it to identify and assess risks to human rights and the environment within their supply chains. GIZ and the ILO have joined forces in order to provide the workers in the enterprises in Serbia belonging to the supply chains of German companies with better access to grievance mechanisms. The project will contribute to easier, fair, and equitable access

projects.description: The HCFC phase-out management plan for Serbia was approved in December 2010 at the 62nd Meeting of Executive Committee of the Multilateral Fund for the implementation of the Montreal Protocol. The second phase aims to achieve 67.5% reduction by 2025 improving health of women and men, boys and girls in Serbia
projects.outcome: Infrastructure norms and standards mainstream climate change and resilience

projects.name: 3.2.2.1 OHCHR - Support to CSOs and their networks to better visibility and more effective interaction with all relevant stakeholders
projects.description: Regular interface with and advisory support to the CSOs and their networks in the reporting, follow-up, monitoring and advocacy for human rights and gender equality, particularly of most vulnerable (Roma, PwD, youth, women, LGBTI), and participating in State-led processes.
projects.outcome: Civic engagement and representation are enhanced for the benefit of society

projects.name: UNIDO-Fostering Industry 4.0 for green transition and circular economy in the Western Balkans
projects.description: In the context of the innovation Agenda for Europe and the smart specialization, in order to support the Western Balkans in benefiting from the rapid development of frontier technologies and to strengthen linkages between science and business in the region, UNIDO proposes to foster regional economic and industrial integration and inclusion of emerging innovation ecosystems of Western Balkans and Eastern Partnership into a wider EU economic and technological landscape. projects.outcome: Science, technology, and innovation benefit men and women equally

projects.name: 1.1.4.12 UNDRR-Building resilience of SMEs
projects.description: Support to SMEs including women owned businesses to enhance gender responsiveness and resilience agenda, strengthen business continuity planning and capacity for risk assessment.
projects.outcome: Communities have increased resilience to climate induced and human-made disasters

projects.description: The activity promotes constructive narratives and counters hate speech in order to increase inter-group dialogue, mutual understanding and gender equality. projects.outcome: Regional and transborder cooperation, security, and trust building are enhanced

projects.name: 1.2.2.16 FAO - Enhancing the resilience of Serbian forests and their carbon storage potential
projects.description: 1.2.2.16 FAO - The project will provide the competent Ministry, especially the Institute of Forestry in Belgrade and the Institute of Lowland Forestry and Environment in Novi Sad, with the necessary technical expertise and guidelines for defining basic data needed to develop a gender-inclusive investment Concept Paper submitted to the Green Climate Fund Secretariat, for consideration.

projects.name: Activities to ensure independence of producers of statistics and access to relevant data sources in line with Principles
projects.description:
Ensure independence of producers of official statistics and access to relevant data sources in line with the Fundamental Principles of Official Statistics (General Assembly Resolution 68/261) by having adequate statistical legislation: Workshop on Statistical legislation.
In partnership with EDTA, EUROSTAT, DESA and Armstat.
projects.outcome: Governance systems for planning, budgeting, and monitoring of national and local development are more efficient and SDG focused

projects.name: 2.2.1.6 Integration of Media and Information Literacy (MIL) concept into formal education in Serbia through elaboration and adoption of MIL policies and strategies - UNESCO
projects.description: In close cooperation with the Ministry of Education of the Republic of Serbia as well as the Institute for the Improvement of Education and Training, and the Institute for Evaluation of the Quality of Education and Training, this activity will support the integration of MIL (Media and Information Literacy) concept into formal education system in Serbia. projects.outcome: Formal education (incl. TVET) becomes a key enabler for leaving no one behind

projects.description: The aim of the project is to develop innovative approaches to cultural policy measures of local cultural actors (local municipalities, artists, NVOs, small enterprises, entrepreneurs) by boosting their active involvement in fair development of the creative sector and participatory planning through capacity building training.

projects.name: 2.1.3.12 UNWomen - Safeguarding of Women and Girls in Serbia
projects.description: To prevent and address all manifestations of gender-based violence, including in public spaces, the main project goal is to increase knowledge and responsiveness of national and local authorities and stakeholders to violence against women and girls, in private and public spaces, and to apply internationally validated tools and practices to better address this issue. Another important focus is improvement of performance and availability of services of shelters for victims of GBV.
projects.outcome: State institutions and CSOs ensure effective prevention and improved access to gender sensitive quality services for survivors of violence, exploitation and abuse

projects.name: 3.2.2.13 Joint Programme (FAO) Digital Service Design Hub – Clicking Together with Citizens
projects.description: The JP aims to support the Government of Serbia (GoS) in harnessing technology for a deeper transformation of public services, relying on considerable user-centric service design expertise prevalent in Serbia’s tech sector, exemplified by UN values. The JP is set to expand digital services accessibility, especially for vulnerable groups, and to improve the public's access to rights and opportunities.
